result.execSummary:
The defendant Erick E Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Notice of right to seek postconviction relief
and returned.
Minutes emailed to DOC

Court reporter Lynn Schultz. Defendant Erick E Anderson in court.  Attorney Mark A Leonard in court for Erick E Anderson.  Attorney Lillian Rose Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin. Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to counts 1 and 3.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

AMENDMENTS: 

On Motion of the State, the Court DRI Count #2 and 4.

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT #1      
Court I/S a sentence of: 
-Serve 90 days in the DCJ, with Huber; cc to count 3 and cc to 21CM1560

-Stayed for 18 months probation cc to count 3 and cc to 21CM1560

COUNT #3      
Court I/S a sentence of: 
-Serve 90 days in the DCJ, with Huber; cc to count 1 and cc to 21CM1560

-Stayed for 18 months probation cc to count 1 and cc to 21CM1560

CONDITIONS:
-No threats/acts of violence against: J.L.A

-Certified/DOC DV treatment
-Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals 
-DNA on file
-Early termination after 12 months with agent approval
-Any other conditions DOC may impose

COURT COSTS:
Ct #1 and 3
-DA surcharge (ct 1 only) due on probation
- All CC and DNA surcharge waived. V/W surcharge due on probation

-Days credit if revoked: Zero (Atty Leonard has 30 days to submit jail credit)

DE advised of post-conviction rights

[Jaime D]
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services

SIGNATURE BOND CONDITIONS MODIFIED - GPS TRACKING REMOVED AS CONDITION
Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
The Court ordered a signature bond on the condition that the defendant reports to and complies with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: __ GPS, _x_ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor. 
- Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence toward Jamie A. 
- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol. 
Trial Judge - Br 17

Court reporter Teri Groves. Defendant Erick E Anderson in court.  Attorney Mark A Leonard in court for Erick E Anderson.  Attorney Lillian Rose Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court makes findings and will remove the no contact conditions with Jaimie A to be changed to no acts or threats of violence towards Jaimie A. Also the address ban at 300 block of E Jefferson Street is also removed. The no contact with the minor child condition is also removed. All other bail conditions will remain the same.

01:31 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Crystal A Vera.  Frank Remington appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
